name: Engagement Intake + Convergence Brief
trigger_signals: new engagement; unclear scope; paid commitment; stakeholder misalignment
intervention_pattern: Run a structured intake to converge on: user, jobs-to-be-done, constraints, success definition, and explicit non-goals. Produce a single-page Convergence Brief used as the engagement source of truth.
agents: Architecture: Draft Convergence Brief with explicit assumptions and non-goals; Search/Research: Collect prior art + internal references relevant to customer domain; Validator/Safety: Check for missing constraints, one-way doors, and unbounded commitments
success_quality: No unowned requirements; all constraints captured

name: Stakeholder Map + Communication Cadence
trigger_signals: multiple stakeholders; slow approvals; cross-functional dependencies
intervention_pattern: Create stakeholder map (deciders/influencers/approvers), RACI-lite, and a cadence (weekly demo + async updates).
agents: Search/Research: Identify org/roles and prior communications templates; Architecture: Define cadence + escalation paths; Implementation: Set up lightweight tooling (docs, tracker, templates)
success_safety: Escalation path defined for blocking issues

name: Problem → Task Decomposition (RIU Mapping)
trigger_signals: complex system; multiple deliverables; uncertain path
intervention_pattern: Decompose the engagement into Workstreams and select an initial set of RIUs (materials/tools). Identify gaps where no RIU exists and create Candidate RIUs.
agents: Architecture: Produce decomposition + initial RIU set; Search/Research: Locate similar past engagements/RIUs; Validator/Safety: Ensure each RIU has success metrics and reversibility classification
success_outcome: Clear executable plan with multiple RIUs
success_quality: Every task mapped to at least one RIU or flagged as gap

name: Data Contract Freeze
trigger_signals: unknown schema; multiple sources; PII concerns; integration blocks
intervention_pattern: Extract schemas, access paths, SLAs, PII handling, and sample payloads into a single versioned data_contract.yaml with examples and validation rules.
agents: Search/Research: Gather existing schema docs and sample payloads; Implementation: Generate contract + validators; Validator/Safety: Check PII risks and completeness
success_outcome: Integration unblocked; shared understanding of inputs/outputs
reversibility: One-way door if external interface is promised; otherwise two-way

name: Access + Permissions Readiness
trigger_signals: blocked access; missing credentials; security review
intervention_pattern: Create an access checklist (accounts, tokens, roles, network), validate least-privilege paths, and confirm data movement boundaries.
agents: Architecture: Define access requirements + boundary diagram; Validator/Safety: Ensure least-privilege + logging expectations; Implementation: Test access programmatically (read-only where possible)

name: PII/Compliance Triage
trigger_signals: PII; HIPAA; PCI; SOC2; GDPR; regulated industry
intervention_pattern: Classify data sensitivity, define redaction/minimization, establish audit log requirements, and create an allowlist of safe processing operations.
agents: Validator/Safety: Produce compliance triage report + controls; Architecture: Define safe patterns + data minimization; Search/Research: Collect customer policy references
reversibility: One-way door when commitments are made

name: Retrieval Baseline + Evaluation Harness
trigger_signals: RAG; search quality issues; no baseline metrics
intervention_pattern: Define golden queries, expected doc families, and implement offline eval (precision@k, MRR, coverage) plus regression checks.
agents: Evaluator: Create golden set + evaluation runner; Implementation: Implement metrics + reports; Validator/Safety: Ensure tests gate deployments
success_safety: Ship decisions tied to eval results

name: Sidecar Intelligence Artifact (Read-Only Augmentation)
trigger_signals: need rerank; need explainability; cannot change KB
intervention_pattern: Write per-doc sidecar JSON with canonical coordinates, freshness class, computed signals, embedding ref, and reason codes. Never modifies source docs.
agents: Architecture: Define minimal sidecar schema + contracts; Implementation: Implement sidecar writer + reader library; Validator/Safety: Schema validation + rollback plan
success_outcome: Optional rerank/explain works without KB changes
reversibility: Two-way door (unless external consumers depend on sidecars)

name: Freshness / Staleness Guardrails
trigger_signals: publication lag; stale recommendations; silent removals
intervention_pattern: Implement deterministic freshness classes (Fresh/Aging/Stale/Orphaned), downrank rules, and orphan detection using snapshot last-seen timestamps.
agents: Architecture: Define rules + thresholds; Implementation: Implement guardrails + tests; Evaluator: Add staleness cases to golden set

name: Similarity: 'Seen This Before' Exemplars
trigger_signals: need precedents; customer asks 'similar'; reduce cognitive load
intervention_pattern: Hybrid similarity: enum overlap + embeddings. Produce top neighbors with reason codes; avoid LLM prose by default.
agents: Embedding/Similarity: Build embeddings + ANN index; Implementation: Serve neighbors + reason codes; Validator/Safety: Ensure neighbors have explainable reasons

name: Integration Adapter (API/Webhook/Connector)
intervention_pattern: Choose integration mode (API pull, webhook push, batch), define contract, implement adapter with retries, idempotency, and observability.
agents: Architecture: Select integration mode + tradeoffs; Implementation: Build adapter + retries/idempotency; Debugging: Resolve failures under load
success_safety: One-way door flagged if external contract is published
reversibility: One-way door if external interface committed

name: Feature Flags + Rollback Plan
trigger_signals: new behavior; risk of regression; pilot rollout
intervention_pattern: Implement feature flags for new capabilities; define rollback path; create staged rollout plan by segment.
agents: Architecture: Define flag strategy + rollout gates; Implementation: Implement flags + kill switch; Evaluator: Define regression gates

name: Sales Narrative + 'No-Lie' Capability Statement
trigger_signals: rebrand; customers paid; scope ambiguity; risk of overpromise
intervention_pattern: Write a truthful capability statement: what exists, what is in pilot, what is out of scope; include examples and caveats; align with support readiness.
agents: Architecture: Define truthful boundaries + non-goals; Search/Research: Collect relevant customer language + precedents; Validator/Safety: Check for implicit commitments and one-way doors

name: Customer Workshop: Problem Framing Session
trigger_signals: customer unclear; multiple asks; needs alignment
intervention_pattern: Run a 60–90 minute workshop to produce: problem statement, constraints, success metrics, and prioritized tasks mapped to RIUs.
agents: Architecture: Facilitate workshop + produce outputs; Search/Research: Prepare domain examples and questions; Validator/Safety: Identify one-way doors and hidden requirements

name: Taxonomy Drift Capture (Candidate Rows)
trigger_signals: new terms; no matching RIU; novel problem
intervention_pattern: When no RIU fits, create Candidate RIU with: triggers, pattern, artifacts, validation. Track repeated occurrences and promote only after success + review.
agents: Architecture: Draft candidate RIU row; Validator/Safety: Ensure bounded scope and reversibility; Search/Research: Find prior art / analogous RIUs
success_safety: No auto-promotion to canonical without governance
